cases.title: Disk CMEK Disabled
cases.description: Disks on this VM are not encrypted with CMEK or CSEC.

cases.title: Egress Deny Rule Not Set
cases.description: An egress deny rule is not set on a firewall.

cases.description: Firewall rule logging is disabled.

cases.title: Compute Secure Boot Disabled
cases.description: This Shielded VM does not have Secure Boot enabled.

cases.title: Compute Serial Ports Enabled
cases.description: Serial ports are enabled for an instance, allowing connections to the instance's serial console.

cases.title: IP Forwarding Enabled
cases.description: IP forwarding is enabled on instances.

cases.title: OS Login Disabled
cases.description: OS Login is disabled on this instance.

cases.title: Public IP Address
cases.description: An instance has a public IP address.

cases.title: Shielded VM Disabled
cases.description: Shielded VM is disabled on this instance.

cases.title: Org Policy Confidential VM Policy
cases.description: A Compute Engine resource is out of compliance with the constraints/compute.

cases.title: Default Network
cases.description: The default network exists in a project.

cases.title: Default Network
cases.description: A legacy network exists in a project.

cases.title: Bucket CMEK Disabled
cases.description: There are private subnetworks without access to Google public APIs.

cases.title: Cluster Logging Disabled
cases.description: Logging isn't enabled for a GKE cluster.

cases.title: Cluster Monitoring Disabled
cases.description: Monitoring is disabled on GKE clusters.

cases.title: COS Not Used
cases.description: Compute Engine VMs aren't using the Container-Optimized OS that is designed for running Docker containers on Google Cloud securely.

cases.title: Legacy Authorization Enabled
cases.description: Legacy Authorization is enabled on GKE clusters.

cases.title: Master Authorized Networks Disabled
cases.description: Master Authorized Networks is not enabled on GKE clusters.

cases.title: Network Policy Disabled
cases.description: Network policy is disabled on GKE clusters.

cases.title: Pod Security Policy Disabled
cases.description: PodSecurityPolicy is disabled on a GKE cluster.

cases.title: Private Cluster Disabled
cases.description: A GKE cluster has a Private cluster disabled.

cases.title: Web UI Enabled
cases.description: The GKE web UI (dashboard) is enabled.

cases.title: Workload Identity Disabled
cases.description: Workload Identity is disabled on a GKE cluster.

cases.title: Auto Repair Disabled
cases.description: A GKE cluster's auto repair feature, which keeps nodes in a healthy, running state, is disabled.

cases.title: Auto Upgrade Disabled
cases.description: A GKE cluster's auto upgrade feature, which keeps clusters and node pools on the latest stable version of Kubernetes, is disabled.

cases.title: COS Not Used
cases.description: Compute Engine VMs aren't using the Container-Optimized OS that is designed for running Docker containers on Google Cloud securely.

cases.title: Legacy Metadata Enabled
cases.description: Legacy metadata is enabled on GKE clusters.

cases.title: DNSSEC Disabled
cases.description: DNSSEC is disabled for Cloud DNS zones.

cases.title: RSASHA1 For Signing
cases.description: RSASHA1 is used for key signing in Cloud DNS zones.

cases.title: Audit Logging Disabled
cases.description: Audit logging has been disabled for this resource.

cases.title: Primitive Roles Used
cases.description: A user has the basic role, Owner, Writer, or Reader. These roles are too permissive and shouldn't be used.

cases.title: Redis Role Used On Org
cases.description: A Redis IAM role is assigned at the organization or folder level.

cases.title: Service Account Key Not Rotated
cases.description: A service account key hasn't been rotated for more than 90 days

cases.title: KMS Key Not Rotated
cases.description: Rotation isn't configured on a Cloud KMS encryption key.

cases.title: Auto Backup Disabled
cases.description: A Cloud SQL database doesn't have automatic backups enabled.

cases.title: SSL Not Enforced
cases.description: A Cloud SQL database instance doesn't require all incoming connections to use SSL.

cases.title: Sql No Root Password
cases.description: A Cloud SQL database doesn't have a password configured for the root account.

cases.title: Bucket CMEK Disabled
cases.description: A bucket is not encrypted with customer-managed encryption keys (CMEK).

cases.title: Bucket Policy Only Disabled
cases.description: Uniform bucket-level access, previously called Bucket Policy Only, isn't configured.

cases.title: Bucket Logging Disabled
cases.description: There is a storage bucket without logging enabled.

cases.title: Locked Retention Policy Not Set
cases.description: A locked retention policy is not set for logs.

cases.title: Object Versioning Disabled
cases.description: Object versioning isn't enabled on a storage bucket where sinks are configured.
